subject: RE: [junit] Help needed
msgSnippet: The main thing to remember is that tests are there to ensure that desired behaviour is implemented correctly. That s it (oh, and according to J.B., to ensure
messageBody:
The main thing to remember is that tests are there to ensure that desired behaviour is implemented correctly. That's it (oh, and according to J.B., to ensure that your fear turns to boredom :-)

To this end, you are not testing methods. Sure, many methods implement a distinct behaviour, but many do not. So, in your code, aim for public methods that are the entry point for a behaviour and then create private methods as required to help that public method get the behaviour implemented in a clear fashion.

Then .... test the public methods, checking for the side-effects and return value. If there is no side-effect of or return code from a method, then consider sending it to the bit-bucket.

Simon

>-----Original Message-----
>From: james.dobson@... [mailto:james.dobson@...]
>Sent: Thursday, January 29, 2004 9:28 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: RE: [junit] Help needed
>
>
>Why don't you just test the public methods?
>
>If aa() and bb() are 'helper' methods that came about from
>re-factoring you
>can ignore them.
>
>Just make sure you test XYZ() with all the necessary
>parameters and leave it
>at that. If XYZ is passing the wrong values to aa() and bb()
>then the unit
>test that stresses XYZ() will fail. Right?
>
>James
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: mona ahuja [mailto:mahuja@...]
>Sent: 29 January 2004 00:05
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com'" <junit@yahoogroups.com>"
>Subject: [junit] Help needed
>
>
>Hi,
>I have a question if I have a method in a class which calls 2
>other methods
>of the same class. How do unit test this method.How do I check if its
>passing correct parameters to other methods. eg
>method XYZ()
>{
>int x;
>int y;
>aa(x);
>bb(y);
>}
>aa() ,bb(),XYZ() are all methods of the same class.
>I can unit test aa() and bb()in isolation but how do I test
>that methos XYZ
>is passing correct values tp aa and bb
>
>
>
>
>
